caption: I grew up back east and this is some of the best pizza to be found west of New York!
Tony's Pizzeria is a MUST! hands down the best pizza in town.

I went in this evening I was delivering for postmates and was sent here not knowing that "they aparently do not do these services" I walked in with what to order and pay with the company card. The woman was allowing me to order and then a guy shouted from the kitchen very rudly "are you with postmates, uber eats etc waiving his hands." I was shocked and responded politey postmates. He then said we don't do that not an apology or anything. It was not a prepaid order so was confused and said Oh I just order and pay and he proceeded to say NO and tell me he sent letters and requested it to be canceled but was making me feel like it was my fault and I was only there to do my job. With how rude I was treated I will never bring my family here.
Best pizza around.
high quality pizza and service. love this family and this place. my best nights can be traced back to Tony's. don't forget to try the cheesecake.
Ummmmm. Yummmmm. This place is all star, genuine, classy, hands down awesome.
If you’ve been to Naples and had the best pizza in the world, you can have it again and save the airfare with a visit to Tony’s!
Ate here years ago when visiting Boise, and my girlfriend and i still bring it up in conversation to gush about how good it was
burnt pizza with roaches
Literally horrible. Literally so bad. The roaches crawling were bad!

I'm from NYC and this pizza brought me back home!!!!  Simply amazing.  Tony and his wife, as well as the staff are top notch and the pizza is made by hand and fired right there. Tonny is from Brooklyn and boy so are his pizza!  Great wine list and location.   Dont let this hiden gem pass you.  :)
Best Pizza in Boise, Best Service, Best atmosphere
I love the pizza and the people who work here are nice
Delicious, fresh made pizza at a good price. Friendly staff and great service.
Amazing! Food and atmosphere was fantastic. Loved it.
Love this little Italian place!!!
The best calzone
Good food
Very friendly staff and great pizza. A little on the spendy side, but worth a try.
Went to 10's of places in Boise trying to find the best pizza. I can say without a doubt that this is the absolute best. A small, cozy place, with absolutely delicious food.
Lunch calzone was delicious.  Might be the best marinara I've ever had
The pizza was good, but it would have been better if the hostess didn't spend 10 minutes talking me out of what I really wanted to order.

I’m a Boise native and had always wanted to try this place! I finally did a few weeks ago and I loved it! Small, intimate, and cozy place. Our waitress was very kind and laid back exactly my vibe! And I can’t forget about the delicious pizza that I actually wanted to eat the crust !!
Amazing pizza and salad, very good service

This was a few months ago, but I had to make a point of sharing the overall attitude of this establishment. Worst experience eating pizza ever!! Line out the door, so I grabbed a menu to look over while waiting in line. Waitress snatched it out of my hands while I’m looking at it and explains how they’ve had people steal their menus before. Wow!! Must be some pretty special paper it’s on. The whole time we were there, we felt out of place, like we were in some exclusive, overly pretentious pizza club that we weren’t a part of. The waitress talked down to us several times and the a few of the other older clientele were looking over all snooty because my kids were talking at a normal level, but they’re 3 and 4, so they have high voices. A lady looked over at my 4 year old daughter and “shooshed” her at one point, she knew the staff by name, so I assume she was a regular. My 13 year old sister-in-law was almost in tears by the end because she felt so self conscious about the uppity customers looking at us as if we were lower class the whole time. The waitress made a comment about “maybe dressing up next time” For Pizza??? We adults were wearing BSU apparel after a game on a Saturday, the kids were in long sleeves and jeans. Who knew??  By the way, the pizza was pretty good, but expensive and small. We spent over $100 feeding 2 adults, 2 children and a teenager.
Excellent pizza my wife even liked it.! :-)
I've been wanting to try this place for a while now, but when I finally did I wish I had done it earlier! The pizza crust is amazing! This is a hidden gem...
Great!
Read the menu carefully and check if there is sauce. My own fault but the pizza was delicious and service satisfactory.
The pizza is the best in town!
Tony's Napolitano heritage and his love of pizza shine in this wonderful little spot right by the historic Egyptian Theater.
Awesome

Really wanted to try this place for he first time; but as we walked up to the door at 8:40pm tonight, (mind you they close at 9:30) the waitress turned the closed sign in our faces as we went for the door.  There were still people in the restaurant and some had obviously just been seated as they had menus.  Pretty poor customer service on a Saturday night.
Quaint place, yet Terrific Pizza!! Highly recommended!!
Amazing food! Ingredients are super fresh, from the taste I would guess prepped daily. Owner and staff are very polite and friendly. I would recommend to anyone.

I had the New Yorker and it was delicious!  The tomato sauce was my favorite part!  Very well spiced.  Also, the crispy yet pliable crust was very satisfying to eat.  The dining area is small and intimate.  Perfect for a date.  The owner was super friendly and gracious.  The pizza is a bit on the pricey side, but is 100% worth it especially if you value quality.  I will definitely be back.
This place has the best pizza in town! This being said, it takes forever for you to get your food. Only come here if you have an hour and a half to kill.
Cozy atmosphere, wood fired pizza was delicious!!

I'm not from the area, but I am assuming this is a hidden gem! This was honestly the best Neapolitan style pizza I have ever had (I've been to Italy)! They have two vegan options, which weren't listed as such, but good to know if you have dietary restrictions as I do. The staff were super friendly, Tony was flipping pizzas and helping to accommodate my needs! I have never experienced an owner cooking the food, definitely shows how passionate he is for his business!  I had the number 1, marinara I believe, added extra sauce, olives, sauteed mushrooms, and fresh arugula. They set down parmesan, crushed peppers, balsamic, and olive oil. Definitely recommend adding the balsamic and olive oil to your pizza! I have never had that offered at another pizzeria, a total game charger! Their balsamic is amazing, tastes like Italian balsamic, which if you've been there you know what I mean!:) It's a small little shop, plays opera music, highly highly recommend!  Thank you Tony!:)
Wonderful employees, service. Best pizza in Boise and creative antipasto platter. Great recommendation for wine pairing. I feel like I'm eating with family each time I'm here!
Great pizza and good service!
Authentic Italian great food been going here for years love you guys
Amazing

The best option for pizza since Cassanova closed. Just wish there was more seating to ensure I could always get in. Although there is something nice about the intimate setting.  My only complaint is they used barely ripe Sysco tomatoes for the caprese. Come on,  it's August in Idaho! If you can't serve ripe tomatoes right now, when can you? Who cares if local produce isn't a uniform size to match the mozzarella.
Good pizza and appetizers.  But they have only have 8 beers and one of them is Amstel Light.  5 stars if they had a beer selection.

World class pizza. You won’t be disappointed, Tony’s is criminally underrated in Boise. Great date spot but not a ton of room inside if you have a big party. Tony is the man, too, and takes a lot of pride in his product, and it shows.
Always the best pizza in town if you want flavor and true Italian
Outstanding, very authentic thin-crust pizza, and the best cheesecake I've had anywhere.

Tony is an artist and a fine one at that. Come to appreciate the craft he has honed over many years, stay for the amazing quaint atmosphere and feel as though you have been transported back to the old country. If you are looking to treat yourself, go to Tony's for a fine traditional pizza pie.

Very good pizza and Tony the owner is really nice. My only concern is that the pizzas are small - only 13 inches or so. We really enjoyed the pizzas but two pies were no where near enough for two adults and 4 kids. We ordered a full order of focacia which was also great.
Best pizza in town! Hours are a little tough but for a pre-event dinner at the Egyptian, it's great.
Best pizza and calzones in town.
Best food I’ve ever eaten.
The best pizza restaurant I have been to in Boise.
Best pizza in Boise. Fine dining service. Nice wine selection. Beautiful salads. Quiet, lovely music. Couldn't be better.

Tony's Pizza is the best. I was visiting Boise, working in the Egyptian Theater which is the building he is in, and I could smell the wonderful pizza so I tried it and went back every day for lunch. The food is only 1/2 of the fun though, talking with Tony is the other half! What a hoot! When I go back next if I do, I will spend time at Tony's, Try it when in the area, you won't be sorry!
Great place to dine out for pizza with wine. Would have given a 5, but a little on the small side for space.
Haven't been their so cannot comment.
Great food, service, cute atmosphere.
The best pizza in the world!
The pizza is tremendous!
Best Italian food ever!!

The atmosphere was amazing and the food made it even better. The pizza was great and very authentic. My husband is a chef and has traveled for the sole purpose of food and this place blew him away. We will definitely be back. The price was worth it for a great product.
Best pizza in Boise, hands down.
Great pizza and calzones, but they can be a little skimpy on the toppings. Service was friendly as well.
Best pizza in town! Chef/owner really cares about putting out the best ingredients and also infusing it with love!
Best authentic pizza...fresh ingredients...cozy.

The pizza is very good.  However it is not the most budget friendly.  A 13" pizza will go for $13-20.  Since it is a thin crust, a hungry person can eat a whole pizza.  The flavor of the crust is very tasty and light.  The sauce is perfection.  The margarita pizza for have a little more toppings.  They would be 5 stars if is was a little more budget friendly and a little more toppings.
Best gourmet pizza in Idaho. Place is real small.
A little small but great pizza

Went there for the first time and the place is nice and cozy. The family orientation they have reminds me of the family restaurants back east. They all acknowledge you and are actively involved making sure you are happy and comfortable.

Seriously hands down head and shoulders (and entire body) above THE best pizza in Boise and very likely Idaho, because as a native NJ girl I think this pizza is -- gasp! -- even better than the pizza of my youth in NY and NJ (which is still the benchmark of good pizza to me). Makes sense, too, because Tony's family runs a generations-old pizzeria in Naples. Tony's pizza really actually gives me The Feels. The crust the crust THE CRUST -- crunchy and light...that RIGHT crust. Not like the heavy slab crust you find so many places that think they're making pizza but then put a bunch of rando stuff on it. Eat a margherita pizza at Tony's -- sauce, mozzarella, light basil -- and you'll see THAT is pizza and doesn't need to be camouflaged under cutesy combinations. That said, the sausage and spinach (#7 I believe?) and the thinly sliced pork, goat cheese, arugula (#17?) -- those will bring a tear to your eye. I am not exaggerating. Talk to Tony for two minutes and you'll understand why -- he is doing this with LOVE, passion, major skills and talent, wonderful ingredients, perfect pizza oven. This isn't about any cheffy ego that leaves you feeling empty. You can just taste the difference. This is true real amazing pizza. Big soul.

The best pizza and cheesecake that I have had in years. My fiancé had been going here since she was 11 and has never stopped lauding the sauce.  The crust was incredible. The food is great and so are the people.  I am glad I made the trip from nyc.
Such a great place for families, the food is delicious. It's seriously the best pizza in Boise!

Pizza so good it will make you want to slap your grandma!!! But seriously this is the real thing, you would have to go to  Naples Italy to get better, it's so good I can't believe it is  in Boise Idaho!
Authentic pizza baking techniques, but not the highest quality toppings. It is a Boise institution but could up its game if they bought more seasonal, local, fresher vegetables.
Worst service we have ever had! Waited over an hour to eat, way over priced and definitely not coming back.
Yummy food all around! The bread with salad was amazing, the calzones and pizza were great too. Great service!
Everything was excellent!!! I highly recommend this restaurant to all who love authentic Italian food.

I've never been to Italy but I hear from friends that frequent Italy that this is as authentic as it gets. You won't ever see this place driving by but it is an experience you won't forget. Tony is the owner and grew up in Italy. He still comes in every day and whips up fresh dough from an old family recipe. I haven't had a pizza I didn't love. If you're downtown and hungry, you have got to try this place.
One of the best...in the nation. The freshest ingredients, moderately priced, and a real experience of dining out that's often skipped over today...
Excellent food! The canzones take a little longer to make, but so worth the wait...
Authentic Italian pizza
Hands-down the best Pizza in Boise!  Authentic, Napoli-style pizza and a great selection of Italian wines, coupled with a cozy ambience.  Sorry, Flatbread, but we are now sold on Tony's.  :-)

We love to have a romantic date at Tony's.  The atmosphere is close & personal, you can complement the chef as he's cooking in front of you.  The selection of wines is wonderful.  Over many years I have only had wonderful meals & experiences at Tony's!!
Service here is great, and the pizzas are spot on with flavor.  The interior has a nice pizzeria atmosphere, and you can see the oven from some tables

I have never eaten here but I met the owner today. He saw me parking in the loading zone in front of his established business and came out and gave me a hard time about trying to get my job done and threatened to have me ticketed for no reason.  The time he wasted on me could have been better spent with one of his customers questioning thier experience, considering the loading zone in front of his pizzeria is open to all delivery vehicles at any time of the day for any given amount of time,  no limits. I will never eat here after the experience with the owner, but I will continue to use the loading zone for its intended purpose, even if it does obstruct the view of his business. And I will never go into Tony's and interfere with him trying to run his kitchen either.
Best pizza I've never had in Boise (I'm Italian you can trust me on that :-)
Best in Boise bar none! Tony is great; the staff is friendly; and the food is world class. This is a gem hidden right downtown next to the Egyptian.
BEST pizza in the state!  The pizza is the perfect amount of char and chewiness.  You must try the Dolce vita!
